section.title: Introduction
section.p: Everyone likes screenshots :o) This page is meant to give a short introduction into DingsBums?! due to a lacking manual.

section.title: Opening a Training Stack
section.p: Opening an existing training stack or vocabulary can be done in two ways:

ul.li: Use the dynamic menu items at the buttom of the File menu.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing the file menu with recent files

section.title: Editing the Document Properties
section.p: The first screen, which appears after loading a training stack shows the document properties. Amongst others you can influence the visibility of certain fields and defining labels for the most important fields to adapt the user interface to your training stack. Future versions will include the possibility to have bi-directional text for languages like Arabic.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing the properties screen

section.title: Making a Selection
section.p: You always work with a selection of entries. The selection screen allows to make a selection based on the status, last learned, score, unit, category and entry type of the entries. The selection is made by pressing the Apply Selection button.
In the status bar at the buttom of the application window the number of currently chosen entries is shown: 433 out of a total of 436 entries.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing the screen to make selections

section.title: List of all Entries
section.p: From the list of entries new entries / cards can be added to the training stack by pressing the Add button. In the upcoming dialog you are able to choose one of the defined entry types to be assigned to the new entry / card. (This dialog does not show up, if only one entry type is defined!).
The score of each entry is shown with a different color. The score range is between 1 and 7.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing the entries list

section.title: Editing an Entry / Card
section.p: The screenshot shows the possibilities to edit an entry depending on its type. Elsewhere in the program an entry type for a Danish noun has been defined. The same entry type for English nouns would most certainly have other attributes (e.g. no genus). Or you might just ignore language details and work with one generic type.
Some of the labels are in Danish to reflect the training stack as defined in the document properties.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing editing an entry

section.title: Editing an Entry Type
section.p: The entry types can be defined with a specific name and a set of attributes. The entry type attributes can contain a number of items.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingBumss?! showing editing an entry type

section.title: Editing the Items of an Entry Type Attribute
section.p: The screenshot shows the same set of attributes as was used for editing a Danish noun in a screenshot above. For each entry type attribute an item is chosen as the default.
An Entry Type Attribute can be (re)used in different Entry types.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing editing entry type attribute items

section.title: Learning
section.p: The application shows the entries one by one without showing the solution. A set of different hints can be used, if the solution cannot be remembered. To activate the hints choose a method in the dropdown box at the buttom of the screen and press once or several times Hint.
The letters of the solution shuffled (the solution is bidrag):

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing learning hint shuffle

section.p: The top part of the solution:

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing learning hint cover

section.p: The first letters of the solution (press several times the Hint button to see more letters):

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing learning hint letter

section.p: Flash shows the solution in a short amount of time, which can be influenced in the preferences screen:

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing preferences for learning hint flash and cover

section.p: Pressing the Show button prints the solution of the current entry / card. The contents of some fields is shown in query mode and of others only when showing the solution. This is defined in the document properties.
The Go menu contains the main navigation between the different screens.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing the solution of a query and the Go menu
